p: where Y represents the predicted number of deaths, α is the offset term for the age-specific population, and β 6 through β 8 represent the estimated coefficient for each viral subtype. After predicting age-specific mortality by cause of death, we calculated viral subtype–specific deaths as the count data using this model. The total number of influenza-associated deaths was expressed as the sum of the count for each viral subtype. To deal with weekly variance and autocorrelation, the Durbin-Watson test was performed and the Akaike information criterion was compared. Finally, we inserted a 1-week lag for mortality in each model. All statistical analyses were conducted in R version 3.4.0 ( https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/old/3.4.0/).
